name: Auto-Knight
description:
Auto-Knight is a puzzle game in which the player's don't get to choose what actions they take.

The player is given a que of actions on the left side of the screen,  and they choose how they use those actions to press the buttons, kill the slimes, and reach the exit

Use the arrow keys to control the direction, and spacebar to restart.

Blocking makes you invincible, and you still move. Attacking has you stay still, but you kill enemies.

This was the first Game Jam game by the Game Development Guild of Granada Hills Charter High School.  Special thanks to Jeremy,  Jess,  and Max for sticking through this, and a shout-out to Clover and Zebedee for the moral support! And of course, thanks to the entire guild for allowing us to meet other students passionate about creating games. -Ben
